newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Friday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover rose slightly to 3.412 billion yuan from 2.955 billion with the seven-day contract the most actively traded.
Trading was more active than Thursday because of heavy trading by the short-term financial centres, money brokerages run by the central bank, traders said.

"Recent heavy domestic A share issues have made money demand increase sharply on the interbank market," one trader said. "Non-banking financial institutions, in particular securities houses, borrowed heavily on the market through the short-term financial centres to bid for the new shares."
Traders said they expected the rates to move around the current level in active trading early next week.
